medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 week ago with nausea being the most prominent. Abdominal pain was epigastric, intermittent, worsening with eating; no radiation to back or shoulder. Initially thought to be precipitated by food. Vomiting occurred several episodes per day, initially nonbilious, transitioning to some bilious emesis in the last few days. Patient has had to induce vomiting for comfort at times.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 1 diabetes, hypercholesterolemia, diabetic retinopathy, benign prostatic hypertrophy, hypertension, vertigo.
